description.narrative: The project-level expected outcome is an increase in the number of health professionals in Morocco and Senegal. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that this investment will strengthen the education sector's competitiveness, through demonstration and replication. The project outcomes are esxpected to be strong based on the sponsor's experience and track record. The contribution to market creation is expected to be is Strong based on the fact that UPM is a leading player in the Moroccan tertiary education market. IFC anticipates the project will encourage systemic changes to existing markets by increasing competitiveness, through demonstration and replication of a scalable cost effective model for education provision.

UPM Pedagogique S.A. (UPM), UPM International S.A. (UPI together with UPM, the Companies) and their subsidiaries (together UPM Group), a Private Higher Education platform, based in Morocco and operating in Morocco and Senegal, have invited IFC to provide up to 14 million financing to support its growth in Morocco and Sub-Saharan African expansion, especially in Senegal (the Project). The project cost, estimated at 50 million, is dedicated to the acquisition of Universite Internationale de Casablanca (UIC) in 2018, will support UPMs development in Morocco, including the new medical faculty, and UPM Groups expansion in Senegal through UPI (extension of the medical school). UPM Group will use the main portion of the IFC Loan to expand organically in the educational health sector in Morocco (acquisition of medical equipment for the health faculty). The remaining of the IFC Loan will be used to expand the operations in the medical field in Senegal (extension of the campus and new dorms buildings).

mailing-address.narrative: UPM Pedagogique S.A. Fatima-Zahra El Mehdi Operations Director +212 (0) 5 24 48 70 10 fz.elmehdi@upm.ac.ma 42 312, Marrakech Morocco www.upmp.ac.ma
